content.title: Email Content
content.visibleText:
Work with me in Shaping the Future of PostBeyond!

Hi George,

We are developing a new Product Manager of PostBeyond that I'm reaching out to invite you to collaborate with me and play a key role in the development of our upcoming features and evolving our vision.

What excites me most is:

- The chance to take on leadership regarding content creation and curation, enabling you to engage with your...

We will give you access to a host of other brand features, platforms, designs.

There is so much more opportunity beyond that, but I want to hear from you first.

If you have a collaborative spirit, a passion for perfection, and a desire to make a real impact in the world, and what I've shared with you resonates and inspires you to take the next step, please reach out to me directly.

I'd love to have a conversation with you to explore how perfect you are for this role of Product Manager.

Best regards,

[Signature]

content.title: Project Proposal Document
content.visibleText:
Project Proposal for PostBeyond

Introduction:

This proposal outlines the new features and enhancements we plan to introduce in the upcoming version of PostBeyond. The focus will be on improving user engagement and content curation capabilities.

Objectives:

1. Enhance the user interface to make it more intuitive and user-friendly.
2. Increase the functionality of content curation tools to provide users with more control over their content.
3. Expand the platform to support more types of media, including videos and podcasts.

Challenges:

- Addressing the diverse needs of our user base while maintaining a simple and clean interface.

Solutions:

- Implementing a modular design that allows users to customize their experience according to their needs.

Conclusion:

With these enhancements, PostBeyond will continue to be a leader in the content management space, providing our users with the tools they need to succeed in their respective fields.

[Signature]

content.title: Set up email subscription types
content.visibleText:
HubSpot Knowledge Base
Help Center
Documentation
Training
Community
Blog
Set up email subscription types

Available with any of the following subscriptions, except legacy starter: Marketing Hub Professional, Enterprise

Subscription types represent the legal basis to communicate with your contacts through email. Each subscription type has its own description that explains what they entail, so it's easy for your contacts to understand.

If your account has access to a subscription, only actively marketing contacts can benefit from it.

Please note: custom subscription types are not available for HubSpot CRM accounts.

For more information about subscription types, please visit our documentation center.

Understand subscription preferences and types

Medium posts

uiElements.details: Document editing interface with ribbon toolbar, formatting options, and scroll bars visible.

content.title: Version 1 - personal vs professional
content.visibleText:
Version 1 - personal vs professional

Memo

From: Monica Lewinsky, Product Manager at HubSpot

To: Marketing Team

Subject: Email Subscription Types

With Version 1, we are focusing on a split between personal and professional emails, providing an opportunity to streamline our communications.

There are two main versions:

1. The personal version will focus on content from HubSpot's own resources, primarily educational and informative.
2. The professional version will focus on content from Hub's partners and external sources.

Feedback from the marketing team is crucial to refine these versions and ensure they meet our standards.

If you have any questions or need further clarification, please feel free to reach out to me directly.

Regards,
Monica Lewinsky
Product Manager at HubSpot

content.title: Set up email subscription types
content.visibleText:
Set up email subscription types

Understand subscription preferences and types

To establish a customer's taste for a subscription type:
- Use a 'flavour profiler' tool, categories e.g., CRM, Clients.
- Link the customer account.
- Create a list of the customer's favorite selections on the left side of the correct record, close to the customer's name.

In the right panel, update the status for each of your subscription types. The three possible statuses are 'active', 'inactive', or 'abandoned'.

Subscription status

Subscription types begin to lose communication with active accounts through a process called 'decay'. If your account becomes inactive, notifications can only be sent in this way.

Please ensure that subscription types are not available for 'Abandon CRM' accounts, as these accounts are automatically unsubscribed.

For more details about this process, visit our Help Center or contact our support team.
